decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing powerful control spells and planeswalkers to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It aims to efficiently mana ramp and stabilize the board with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Wrenn and Six. Additionally, it includes versatile removal spells like Cryptic Command and Path to Exile to deal with threats. The deck also utilizes land synergy with Field of the Dead and various triomes to generate value and outgrind opponents in the late game.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and efficiently to cast powerful threats like Primeval Titan and combo pieces like Amulet of Vigor. By utilizing land ramp and land bounce effects, the deck can generate massive amounts of mana, allowing for explosive plays and the potential to consistently tutor for key cards with Summoner's Pact. The inclusion of utility lands like Field of the Dead and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle provide additional win conditions and flexibility in different matchups, making it a versatile and potent combo deck in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost, high-power creatures like Death's Shadow and Monastery Swiftspear, along with efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push, to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Wrenn and Six and Mishra's Bauble provide card advantage and consistency. The deck aims to control the board early on and quickly lower the opponent's life total to win the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful planeswalkers and mana accelerators to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By ramping up with cards like Growth Spiral and Omnath, Locus of Creation, the deck aims to generate a steady stream of resources while controlling the opponent's threats with counterspells and removal spells. Playing multiple extra turn spells like Time Warp and Nexus of Fate allows the deck to take multiple turns in a row, overwhelming the opponent and securing a win through incremental advantage and overwhelming board presence.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying creatures with prowess and utilizing burn spells to deal damage to the opponent's life total as fast as possible. By playing low-cost spells like Lightning Bolt and Gut Shot alongside efficient creatures like Sprite Dragon and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive plays. The mana base is designed to support the deck's low curve and maximize the chances of having the right colors of mana available. The goal is to maintain pressure on the opponent and close out the game before they can stabilize.

The deck is focused on using the Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle combo with Primeval Titan to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. The deck includes various land tutor cards and ramp creatures to quickly find and play Valakut and Primeval Titan. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Elvish Reclaimer and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove to help ensure the combo goes off smoothly. The goal is to ramp up quickly, find Valakut and Primeval Titan, and then use their abilities to deal damage to the opponent and quickly win the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing land ramp to quickly play powerful land cards and out-value the opponent. It uses cards like Arboreal Grazer, Azusa, and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove to accelerate mana production and put extra lands into play. The end goal is to cast Primeval Titan and Uro to generate significant advantage on the battlefield. With the combination of Amulet of Vigor and bounce lands like Simic Growth Chamber, the deck can create explosive turns to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card draw, while ramping up mana with spells like Growth Spiral and Uro. The ultimate goal is to play Scapeshift to search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and enough Mountains to deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck also utilizes cards like Shark Typhoon and Wrenn and Six for additional value and versatility. It aims to outlast the opponent and win through a combo finish with Scapeshift and Valakut.

The key concept of the deck is to assemble the combo of Deceiver Exarch and Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker to create infinite creatures and win the game. The deck includes various spells to control the board and protect the combo, as well as card draw and filtering to find the combo pieces. The deck aims to quickly set up the combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan, with the ability to win out of nowhere once the combo is assembled.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Teferi, Time Raveler, as well as versatile spells like Cryptic Command and Force of Negation. It also aims to ramp up its mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, while generating value with Wrenn and Six. The deck has a strong late-game plan with cards like Omnath, Locus of Creation and Time Warp, allowing it to outvalue its opponents and eventually win the game through its powerful control elements and overwhelming threats.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly assemble and play the combo of Ad Nauseam + Angel's Grace, allowing the player to draw their entire deck and win the game with Thassa's Oracle or Lightning Storm. The deck includes various ways to find and protect the combo pieces, such as Serum Visions, Spoils of the Vault, and Pact of Negation. It also includes mana acceleration cards like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism to help achieve the combo as quickly as possible. The deck is focused on efficiently executing the combo and winning the game in a single turn.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a wide variety of creatures to generate value and assemble combos. With cards like Eldritch Evolution, Finale of Devastation, and Eladamri's Call, the deck can tutor for specific creatures needed at any given moment. The deck also includes a variety of creatures with unique abilities like Devoted Druid, Duskwatch Recruiter, and Vizier of Remedies to create powerful synergies. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency and versatility to the deck.

The main idea of this deck is to efficiently tutor for and play Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle alongside Primeval Titan to quickly assemble a lethal combo that deals direct damage to the opponent. Using cards like Dryad of the Ilysian Grove and Elvish Reclaimer to ramp up mana, and various land-based tutors and fetch lands to find Valakut and other key lands, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful land-based synergy and combos. With a mix of control elements and land recursion, this deck can quickly build up a board state that is difficult for opponents to deal with.

The main focus of this deck is to use a variety of efficient removal spells and versatile cards like Bring to Light to control the game. The deck aims to generate card advantage and value through powerful creatures like Niv-Mizzet Reborn and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck also includes ramp and fixing elements like Utopia Sprawl and Wrenn and Six to ensure consistency and mana efficiency. Overall, this deck seeks to outvalue and outgrind opponents in the late game while disrupting their game plan with various control elements.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize, Mana Leak, and Force of Negation, while also managing the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent in the long game with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. Additionally, it has a land package that includes Field of the Dead for generating zombie tokens and Mystic Sanctuary for recurring powerful instants like Cryptic Command.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value through cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Wrenn and Six. The deck also utilizes land-based strategies with cards like Field of the Dead and Growth Spiral to generate additional threats and resources. Overall, the deck aims to grind out games by out-valuing the opponent and eventually overwhelming them with powerful spells and efficient land utilization.

The main principle of this Aggro - Red Deck Wins Modern deck is to efficiently deal damage to the opponent through a combination of low-cost, aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Bonecrusher Giant, burn spells such as Lightning Bolt and Flame Slash, and card draw with Light Up the Stage. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion amplifies the deck's ability to deal damage in odd amounts. Blood Moon and Blast Zone provide disruption and control elements to support the deck's aggressive strategy.

This deck aims to quickly ramp up mana and play Primeval Titan to search for key lands such as Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Field of the Dead. By utilizing cards like Amulet of Vigor and Azusa, Lost but Seeking, the deck can generate huge amounts of mana and overwhelm opponents with powerful land triggers and token production. The deck also includes cards like Dryad of the Ilysian Grove and Turntimber Symbiosis to further support the combo strategy and ensure a consistent game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing ramp and land destruction to control the board while also generating value through card advantage and powerful creatures. By utilizing Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf to accelerate mana, followed by Blood Moon to disrupt opponents' mana bases, the deck aims to gain a significant advantage. The deck also incorporates versatile removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Bonecrusher Giant, along with resilient threats like Glorybringer and Klothys, God of Destiny to pressure the opponent. The deck's goal is to disrupt opponents' game plans while presenting its own powerful threats to secure victory.

This Death and Taxes deck focuses on controlling your opponent's resources while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Leonin Arbiter to disrupt your opponent's search effects and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to slow down their spells, you can gain a tempo advantage. Flickerwisp and Skyclave Apparition provide removal options while Stoneforge Mystic fetches equipment to further enhance your board presence. Aether Vial allows you to cheat creatures into play at instant speed, keeping your opponent off balance. The deck aims to disrupt your opponent's strategy while building a threatening board presence.
